item.title: London Underground Dot Matrix Typeface
item.description: - The London TFL Dot Matrix Typeface is a collection of fonts that mimic the style of the fonts used in the London Underground's arrival boards and announcement boards.

item.title: Update: U+237C ⍼ &Angzarr;
item.description: - This post is an investigation into the symbol U+237C ⍼ RIGHT ANGLE WITH DOWNWARDS ZIGZAG ARROW.

item.title: Bullshit Jobs (2018)
item.description: - The phenomenon of "bullshit jobs" refers to forms of employment that are considered pointless, unnecessary, or even pernicious by the person doing the job.

item.title: I don't need your query language
item.description: - Every year, new general-purpose database engines are released with new query languages.

item.title: GB Studio: Drag & drop retro game creator for GameBoy
item.description: - GB Studio is a drag and drop retro game creator for the GameBoy handheld video game system.

item.title: People can be convinced they committed a crime that never happened (2015)
item.description: - Research shows that suspects can be convinced they committed crimes that they didn't actually commit - Innocent participants in a study were able to generate false memories of committing crimes after just three hours in an interview environment - Incorporating true details into false event stories made them more believable to the participants

item.title: Ask HN: Why does Apple refuse to add window snapping to macOS?
item.description: - Users are questioning why Apple has not added a feature called "window snapping" to their macOS operating system.

item.title: The Secret Sauce behind 100K context window in LLMs: all tricks in one place
item.description: - Large Language Models (LLMs) can now process an extremely large context window, up to 100K input tokens, during training and inference.

item.title: Review of Hetzner ARM64 servers & experience of WebP cloud services on them
item.description: - Hetzner's ARM64 servers perform well in webP conversion speed, only 8% slower than their AMD64 counterparts, with a 14% price difference and double the amount of RAM.

item.title: Merging bcachefs
item.description: - The bcachefs filesystem was discussed at the 2023 Linux Storage, Filesystem, Memory-Management and BPF Summit, and the process for merging it into the mainline kernel seems closer than ever.
